website_summaries.verdict: Equal parts educational game about wild animals, and adorable giraffe feeding simulator.
pros: Teaches kids the responsibility of designing and running a functioning zoo and plenty of facts about the real-world animals in their park, while having tons of fun playing with and caring for hippos, chimpanzees, tigers, elephants, lions, bears, and much more
cons: Sadly, zoo space is limited, so pick your favorite animals and attractions carefully

customer_reviews.title: Zoo limit!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. Everything about this game is great, except for one catastrophic flaw. The zoo limit. Back in original game you could continue to build and tend your zoo indefinitely, however, these zoos are “full” and then you can no longer add animals or other buildings without deleting other ones from the same park. Meaning you complete a zoo within 30 mins and it’s just over. Horrible purchase. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Timeloader

customer_reviews.title: The game was fun for a while and kept me pretty entertained
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few years ago and played it when I first got my Xbox one. I was really excited for it. The game was fun for a while and kept me pretty entertained, but it did start to get a bit repetitive. The biggest disappointment was when I was about 2-3 hrs into the game and it told me I'd reached zoo capacity. When looking over the total possible space to build on, I'd probably used only about 10% of the available space. But it didn't have the ability to build more, which was a buzzkill since I couldn't continue. It was fun while it lasted, but it didn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: JIP

customer_reviews.title: Addicting fun for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun that my son ended up having to share with me! Age: My 11-year-old loves it. The adults in the house love it. There are several modes. I ended up switching to Sandbox mode so that I could do what I wanted without any worries about money or customer complaints. But I did like having the challenges added in Challenges mode like taking pictures of something. It’s lots of fun to interact with the animals. It would always be nice to have more animals. Once you’ve played for awhile, you would like more variety.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun, for a very short time...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (11) LOVED this game, for the first couple days... And then she maxed it out (built a whole zoo) and wasn't able to build anymore. She hasn't touched it since... If you can get it on sale, great, otherwise save your money...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shady

customer_reviews.title: This game is good until you get to the point where you cant ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is good until you get to the point where you cant add anything else to your zoo, which for me I hit that point after 3 or so hours of playing. The challenges will only let you do one at a time and once you start it you can not stop and switch to a different challenge. THe game will not let you start a new challenge until every part of your old challenge is completed.
customer_reviews.author: rec2797

customer_reviews.title: The graphics are amazing and the kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the kids. The graphics are amazing and the kids love it. I do not like the huge amount of wasted space that is in the design function of the zoo. Not sure why you can't place two squares right next to each other. The other issue I have is the menus. Be prepared to navigate 4-5 menus over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I

customer_reviews.title: Secretly hides learning!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old and I enjoy this game. It teaches about business aspects (ex. profit/loss), how to care for animals, and lets you ve creative as well. The only con is that only one player at a time. The multiplayer is for people to join online.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Could be so much better
customer_reviews.text: The graffics are ok, I expected more from xbox one. Also the restrictions in the game make it boring after a short amount of time. You can only build a small zoo with a limited number of animals. This makes the game too easy for adults. Also, there should be more animal interaction and views. Being able to interact with each animal would be nice. If this was like the computer version it would be so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Looks like fun but i'll need more practice
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a pretty fun game but it looks like we will need to read instructions before playing again. I figured out a lot on my own but was hoping for a more seamless experience. However, given the age of the game..I knew better. The kids love the concept and il just have to play and get help so I can get them going. Who doesn't like a good challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Thatsthegoodstuff

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as the original Zoo Tycoon on the computer
customer_reviews.text: Not as fun as the original Zoo Tycoon on the computer. Wish they would come back with a new version that is compatible with todays platforms. This game limits the animals, the shape of the enclosures and the size of the zoo. That was not an issue in the old game. Both myself and my son lost interest in this game rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tam889

customer_reviews.title: NOPE
customer_reviews.text: 6 year old did not enjoy this game, neither did I. WAY too basic and boring, no freedom in the game, got boring in less than an hour. The old PC version of Zoo Tycoon 2 was amazing and still is - this one was a colossal disappointment. Wondering if I'll be able to even sell it.
customer_reviews.author: HollyJ

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: Was fun for about a hour then got extremely boring. The game was very repetitive and no matter what you did to try and change it, turned out the same.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: HATE IT
customer_reviews.text: This game sucks!!! Nothing like the PC version. Every 'store' or 'animal exhibit' is preconstructed... You can't personalise anything. If you put two objects next to each other they automatically connect with a sidewalk/pathway you cannot customise. On top of all that there is a 'zoo limit'. Which literally just doesn't let you build anything else when there is plenty of land left. So you can't even get all the animals in one zoo. Just don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah McCormick

customer_reviews.title: This is a real educational game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for the XBOX one. We were disappointed when we upgraded from the XBOX 360 to the One to find the older version would not play. This is a real educational game to keep the kids busy
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Although it lacks Koalas, my girlfriend absolutely loves this game. It's tough at times, but it is much more of a "fun" game than a "simulator" game. Which is nice. It does not lack the whole "build a park and set everything up" aspect, it just makes the free roam throughout the park more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: okitobi2

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not that good for the Xbox One. The only feature I enjoyed was using the Kinect to interact with the animals. Over than that there is not much for content in this game. A way to improve is to allow more customization.
customer_reviews.author: EpicMD

customer_reviews.title: A good alternative to violent games
customer_reviews.text: This was fun for our grandsons who are used to violent chasing and shooting games. Appealing, varied, funny.
customer_reviews.author: GNDfan

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: Son was bored with game. Played only a handful of times.

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: If you liked the PC version you will love this one even better you can actually walk around the zoo and also interact with the animals

customer_reviews.title: Trusted Seller

customer_reviews.title: Good family-oriented Xbox game

This game should make everyone happy, and seems to be one of very few family-oriented games available on Xbox One. (The other one is Goat Simulator, which no one should be without).

The game itself has great graphics and we could seriously play it for hours. If you like animals, this game would be perfect for you!

She likes the fact she can create her own little or big zoo and feed all the animals and care for them. The graphics are great and I love the fact there is no violence or cursing going on in this game like so many other xbox games out there have now. She has several of the tycoon games now and none have disappointed. This is a great game at a great price. All ages that like animals and building and designing would enjoy the game.

I bought this game for my Fiancee because she had something similar in the past and loved it. This game she is just upset (and stopped playing it) because you can't keep building and it has a limit. Unfortunately I did not read up on the game before I purchased it because it is a common reason people dislike it. customer_reviews.title: Good "E for Everybody" game to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Fun family game. We bought a copy for my step kids as well so we can link long distance and play together. I am 29 and like it as it reminds me of roller coaster tycoon. You are limited by zoo size which is super irritating as the map is big, and once you finish objectives the zoo gets kind of repetitive. I do wish they had made expansions like on the original to do dinosaurs or sea animals. Not a whole lot of animal variety, but enough to entertain. And it's something I can play while my toddlers watch, just be prepared to "feed the ephalant" constantly.

I'll let you read more detailed reviews from other people, but I'll say that I had a blast with this game (as a 33 year old man) and I would assume kids would love it too. The different themed parks look really cool, the animals are cute, and over all just a game that makes you feel happy.

So I hired all these zookeepers, but my animals are just sitting in their filth all dirty and there is no way to clean them. Game has frustrated me more than I've been able to enjoy it. That being said if it worked without this kink like my friends does, it would be great.

customer_reviews.title: Bad. Just bad
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend wanted to get this game because she always loved playing the old Zoo Tycoon on her computer. After playing for about 20 painstakingly terrible minutes she handed me the controller and said "I'm done." The game is extremely different compared to how these games used to be. Instead of building and managing a zoo, which is what you'd expect, you're a person driving around a golf cart?! I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who has played an older one, because this is not anything like those good games.

customer_reviews.title: If You Love Animals Buy Zoo Tycoon !
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for this game to come down in price and Amazon to the rescue. I received it yesterday and started playing. It's a casual Zoo Tycoon game for all ages. The graphics are top notch and all the animals have precise and realistic movements. The tasks/goals are fairly easy for the most part but just admiring the wildlife and making sure their happy in your Zoo rarely gets old. While playing the game and watching the Elephants, brings back memories of Busch Gardens. Solid game although on the easy side compared to the first two games in the series but still a joy to play. And you can't beat the current price from Amazon.

product_meta.title: Zoo Tycoon XBOX ONE
product_meta.description:
The wildly popular Zoo Tycoon series gets fully-remastered and set to crank up the excitement, challenge, and fun of building the ultimate zoo. Easy to start and easy to play, Zoo Tycoon on Xbox gets you up close and interacting with the animals and zoo, offering intuitive controls and fun tutorials that allow players of all ages to have fun. Create your own unique zoo layouts and manage it all with up to 4 friends! Play smart as animals and guests will react to your creative choices and ultimately decide your chances to become a Zoo Tycoon.

Product Description

• With tons of beautiful species, reactive gameplay and real calendar tie-in, this zoo simulation will charm Tycoon fans and new players alike.
• Perform intuitive face to face interactions with your animals. Adopt, care, and release animals into the wild!
• Design, build and manage your zoo. Keeping your animals happy will keep your guests happy, and happy guests means more money flowing into your zoo.

• With up to 4 friends joining in on the fun online, together you can all take part in the creation and management of your zoo.
• Trade your favorite animals with friends, share your favorite Zoo moments and participate in multiplayer challenges and community events. The entertainment just keeps going.
feature_bullets: Playersup to 4 simultaneously over Xbox Live
The Collaborative Power of the Cloud: Upload and share your zoo with Zoo Tycoon players all over the world or create an incredible zoo with up to four players over Xbox LIVE.
Community Efforts over Xbox Live: Engage in large scale community-wide animal conservation efforts and communicate with other Tycoons via Skype.
Closer Interactions with Kinect: With Kinect, your zoo animals will recognize you and react to your voice and movements like never before and you can seamlessly switch back to a controller.
